text: I experience intrusive memories or flashbacks of a traumatic event.
I feel like I'm reliving a traumatic experience, as if it's happening again in the present moment.
I have nightmares or disturbing dreams related to past trauma.
I avoid places, people, or situations that remind me of the traumatic event.
I feel emotionally numb or disconnected from others since the traumatic event.
I feel like I'm haunted by the past and can't move forward.
I experience intense physical reactions when reminded of the trauma.
I have difficulty remembering important parts of the traumatic event.
I feel like I'm replaying old pain like a broken loop that won't stop.
I have negative thoughts about myself, others, or the world since the trauma.
I can process and move past traumatic experiences without them affecting my daily life.
I feel safe and secure in my daily life without constant hypervigilance.
I can think about past difficult experiences without experiencing intense distress.
I maintain healthy relationships and emotional connections despite past trauma.
I can sleep peacefully without being disturbed by traumatic memories or nightmares.
I feel constantly on edge, as if danger is always nearby.
I have difficulty concentrating or staying focused because of intrusive thoughts about the trauma.
I feel guilty, ashamed, or blame myself for what happened during the traumatic event.
I experience sudden mood changes or angry outbursts that seem disproportionate to the situation.
I can engage in activities I used to enjoy before the trauma without feeling triggered.
